justification: "Studies used the Intervention Rating Profile-15 (IRP-15; Freeman et al., 2018; Gage, MacSuga-Gage, et al., 2017; Grasely-Boy et al., 2023)" indicates this scale was employed to gauge intervention acceptability/social validity.
"Usage Rating Profile -Intervention Revised (URP-IR; LaBrot et al., 2021; LaBrot et al., 2022; Lown, 2020)" is listed among the tools used to assess social validity of the intervention.
The text notes "Behavior Intervention Rating Scale (BIRS; LaBrot et al., 2020)" as another instrument for evaluating acceptability/social validity.
"Targeted Professional Development Acceptability Questionnaire (Freeman et al., 2018)" is named as a measure to assess how acceptable the professional development was to participants.
The article states "Consultation Acceptability and Satisfaction Scale (CASS; LaBrot et al., 2020; Lown, 2020)", showing CASS was used to measure acceptability/satisfaction with consultation.

"One additional measure used was the Desired Teacher Behavior Acceptability Questionnaire (Myers et al., 2011)" directly links this questionnaire to assessing acceptability of desired teacher behaviors.
"One study used the Teaching Pyramid Observation Tool (TPOT; Fox et al., 2014) to measure impact of tiered training on trainee practice (Artman-Meeker et al., 2022)."
construct: teacher implementation of Pyramid Model practices
